CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 5, 1941, pg. 12, reads: "Youth Leaders Plan Conference - The Leaders' Institute, sponsored by the various playgrounds in the Hill District, will be held at the YMCA on Wednesday morning, July 9, beginning at 8:45. This conference is planned to give the volunteer workers and friends of the recreation projects in the Hill a general view of recreation work, and certain hints and activities that may be carried on.  From left to right are shown: James Hamlett of Minersville school, Harry Kenny of McKelvy, Eugene Geller of Miller, Leonard Wright of Watt, Booker Williams of Rose school is the fifth boy planning this affair but was not present when the picture was taken. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: James Hamlett, Harry Kenny, Eugene Geller, and Leonard Wright wearing sleeve patch reading "Pittsburgh Public Schools Playground Leader," standing in front of Pittsburgh Courier newspaper offices
